titleInfo.title: State ex rel Little River Lumber Co v. Whaley et al

mods.abstract: Three hand-drawn maps depicting land in the Appalachian Mountains in Sevier County, before the creation of the Great Smoky Mountains National Park. Most of the land lies between Sugarland Mountain and the Little River. The first map includes a number of original grants for W. H. Trentham, Robert Armstrong, Drury P. Armstrong, and Aaron Armstrong and is an enlargement of a small area on the second map. The Indian Gap Hotel is indicated as are a number of other structures including Davis Brackin, Jack Brackin, A. J. Huff, Andy Quitian, and Jacan Mathes on the second map. The third exclusively shows original grants and the disputed land.

The case involved a dispute over 1300 acres of land on the east side of Sugarland Mountain. Little River Lumber Company claimed land via 1839 TN grant #22683 issued to Drury P. Armstrong (based on entry #1549) and the Whaleys claimed it via adverse possession of junior grant: 1879 TN grant #40880 issued to J. C. & dad Wellington McMahan (based on entry #2680). Whaleys operated a farm on their land.
